SPECIFIC ENTITIES
OBESITY HYPOVENTILATION SYNDROME (OHS)
also known as Pickwickian syndrome. Defined by
hypoventilation (awake PaCO2 >45 mmHg) in the
absence of other causes of hypoventilation. OHS
patients have sleep disordered breathing, and most
have OSA. BMI is usually >35 kg/m2. Treatment
options include respiratory stimulants, ventilatory
support, oxygen therapy, and weight loss
SPECIFIC ENTITIES (CONT’D)

severe daytime hypersomnolence,
cataplexy (loss of postural tone, usually with emo
tions), sleep paralysis (usually happens after sleep
wake transition), hypnagogic hallucinations (visual or
auditory hallucinations during drowsiness)
